column4: So far, so good. According to that thread, I now need to run 'sudo apt-get upgrade -f'. I try running it and I get a bunch of messages like "could not resolve 'archive.ubuntu.com'". OK, so there is some kind of network problem. I know the network is up because I can access it via other computers. I can't even ping IP addresses, so it's not a DNS problem.
ahh, crumbs, sorry FloodBot!
ok, I'll try again
@hhzzzarn: the network is up, but for some reason the machine won't connect to it, hence I can't upgrade
even when I plug in the cable directly
hi hhhzzdarn! yeah, it doesn't connect
(but take into account this is from the maintenance shell, so something has gone wrong ahead of time)
ok, thanks anyway hhhzzzarn
the files aren't a huge deal, but I was hoping there was some way to complete the upgrade

right now the problem (as I perceive it) is that I am not able to run apt-get update because it can't connect to the network. so I am treating this like a network configuration problem, and once I fix that I'll go back to worrying about finishing the upgrade
thats sounds like the correct way to proceed
so, I don't think network manager is even running in this maintenance shell, b/c when I run "ps aux | grep Network" I don't see any result
so, if NetworkManager isn't running, and /etc/network/interfaces doesn't contain an entry for eth0, then it seems like it won't be able to connect to the network, no?
pastebin.org this output: ifconfig  and: cat /etc/resolv.conf
@menkeletor: I think that was addressed to me, right? I ran 'ps aux | grep httpd' and it doesn't show anything.
in progress, just a moment
I like how you elevate me to Op
I don't need paste bin for the output b/c there is virtually none. ifconfig doesn't return *anything* and cat /etc/resolv.conf just has one line "#Generated by Network Manager"
what is Op?
what does this show:  sudo ifconfig
sudo ifconfig also shows no result
is this a computer or a virtual machine, or what?
this is a physical machine sitting right in front of me. It worked fine until I upgraded :(
